hard_avoid_color.note: high-saturation dark reds associated with blood/violence/aggression
dark browns/olives associated with decay, waste, and negative ecological valence
very dark colors may trigger claustrophobic or depressive responses

additional_avoid.note: high-intensity reds may overstimulate children and trigger aggressive responses

prefer_ranges.note: calming blues with moderate saturation and high brightness for children
nature-associated greens and yellows with bright, cheerful presentation

avoid.note: desaturated dark colors may reinforce depressive mood states

gentle_boost.note: moderately saturated cool colors with good brightness for mood support

avoid.note: high saturation colors increase arousal and may exacerbate anxiety
warm high-saturation colors associated with increased physiological arousal

strict_avoid.note: red colors may trigger trauma responses related to blood/violence
sharp contrasts may trigger hypervigilance responses

cultural_sensitivity.note: Color associations vary across cultures - these rules based primarily on Western research

emergency_contacts.note: In therapeutic contexts, ensure qualified supervision is available
